title: Iran's Operation Honest Promise sends drones and missiles toward Israel
summary: Iranian strikes caused 'minor damage' to an Israeli base, army spokesman Daniel Hagari said Sunday. Iran had repeatedly threatened to strike Israel in retaliation for a deadly April 1 air strike on its Damascus consular annex.

title: Biden meeting with his national security team as US pledges 'support' for Israel against Iran
summary: US forces shot down some Iran-launched attack drones flying toward Israel, according to a US defense official.

title: Six killed in Sydney shopping center attack
summary: An assailant stabbed multiple people before being shot dead by the police. He was later identified as a 40-year-old man who suffered from mental illness.

title: Senegal's opposition voters: 'It was social injustice that made us vote for Bassirou Diomaye Faye'
summary: From fishermen to students, many of the country's young people took to the polls to express their rejection of Macky Sall's liberal policies, which they felt ignored their needs.

title: When an American president bought his mistress' silence
summary: One hundred years ago, the Republican Party tried to use money to silence a mistress of Warren Harding, elected after the First World War.

title: Football: Welcome to third tier, Wrexham
summary: Hollywood superstar Ryan Reynolds and fellow actor Rob McElhenney bought the little-known Welsh club for $2.5 million in 2021. It got promoted again, on Saturday.

title: NBA: Wembanyama's rookie season is over
summary: The Spurs say French player Victor Wembanyama won't play on Sunday in their finale.

title: Davos is confronted with a rise in anti-Semitism
summary: In the Swiss resort known for hosting the annual World Economic Forum, coexistence between residents and the ultra-Orthodox Jewish community has turned sour. The city, whose image has been tarnished, is trying to mend fences.

title: With the finale of 'Curb Your Enthusiasm,' Larry David puts an end to Larry David once and for all
summary: The final episode of season 12 brings to a close the last iconic series of the golden age of TV comedy.

title: German industry's relationship with China is at a tipping point
summary: Berlin will have to arbitrate between the interests of its major companies, which continue to expand in China, and the future of German industrial sites.

title: Italian far-right MP wants to take over the country's second-largest press agency
summary: Employees of the agency AGI, owned by the state-owned ENI group, fear that it will join the media outlets already bought by Lega Nord MP Antonio Angelucci.

title: Jacques Lurton, owner of Château Couhins-Lurton and globetrotter, returns to his homeland
summary: This 65-year-old winegrower, who comes from a famous Bordeaux lineage, has adapted working methods and techniques discovered abroad to his estates.

title: Pedestrians in Athens are fed up with the 'obstacle course' of run-down, congested sidewalks
summary: Outraged by the numerous broken sidewalks, which are also cluttered with tables and chairs from cafés or invaded by scooters, annoyed residents are sharing their chaotic daily lives on social media, waiting for the authorities to finally take action.

title: What can we expect from the 'rail pass' promised by Macron?
summary: As announced by the French president in September 2023, the plan for a one-way ticket at €49 per month for young people using certain transport throughout France will see the light of day this summer. The details are currently being worked out.

title: High-risk demonstrations and calls for calm in New Caledonia
summary: Political tensions are running high ahead of major demonstrations in New Caledonia's capital, Nouméa, on Saturday by pro-independence supporters and loyalists.

title: Russia seeks to paralyze Ukraine by destroying its energy infrastructure
summary: All over the country, Russian strikes are deliberately targeting thermal and hydroelectric power stations. In the city of Kharkiv, plunged into darkness at night, emergency equipment is struggling to cope with power cuts.

title: French priest accused of sexually assaulting Inuit children dies
summary: Joannes Rivoire was sought by Canada for sexually abusing Inuit children more than 30 years ago but avoided extradition and prosecution. He died in a nursing home France at age 93, after a long illness.

title: Journalism and Crisis: Join Le Monde in English for a special event in New York!
summary: Le Monde's English edition crosses the Atlantic from April 15-17 for a series of events in New York City, free and open to the public.

title: Iran's attacks on Israel: World leaders warn against escalation, UN Security Council emergency meeting on Sunday
summary: Among the many reactions to Iran's drones and missiles launched at Israel, Saturday, UN Secretary-General Guterres said 'neither the region nor the world can afford another war.'

title: Academic freedom is threatened in the US
summary: Republicans have gone on the offensive to reassert control over higher education, attacking the now-overturned policy of affirmative action in university admissions.

title: In Paris, tour guides show the city through the history of minorities
summary: Eager to bring the history of minorities into the spotlight, several guides are showing the Paris of the Black or LGBT+ communities, and offering a fresh, inclusive look at the capital.

title: Small earthquake on second day of Coachella Festival in California, heavy dose of nostalgia on stage
summary: On Friday, Shakira dropped in for a surprise cameo. Saturday's headliner is Tyler, the Creator, and a No Doubt reunion, while Sunday will close with fellow California native Doja Cat.

title: How Taiwan became a leader of the bicycle industry
summary: While TSMC's semiconductor factories dominate, the cycling giants Giant and Merida, along with their subcontractors, serve as the island's second economic powerhouse.

title: In Belgium, 15 exhibitions to celebrate James Ensor
summary: On the 75th anniversary of the artist's death, Flanders honors his multi-faceted, provocative, and disturbing work.

title: To ban or not to ban TikTok, an American dilemma
summary: For the US House of Representatives, which wants to shut it down or 'nationalize' it, the Chinese platform is a threat to American democracy. But its popularity with users puts Biden, just as it had Trump, in a difficult position.
